at the B.n-OmVe, and at the Libraries of Messrs MITCHELL, SAMS, ALLCROFT, &e,

The purchase of Tickets fei the DRESS CIRCLE, at the Box.-Office, will assure
t h . Placet fot the whole Evening without the usual exaction of an extra Shilling.
Those taken in the sane way for the UPPER CIRCLE, will ensure the Places to
the end of the First Act.
Be Money will be allowed to he received by the Box-keepers, on any pretence
whatever; and it is earnestly requested that any complaint of incivility may be Instantly
addressed to Madame VESTRIS,
Separate Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes, on both sides of t h .
Honse, have been constructed in Burleigh Street and Wellington Street.

the Place, for the whole Evening without the usual exaction of an extra Shilling.

at the Box-Office, and at.the Libraries ..f Messrs. M I T C H E L L , S A M S , A L L C R O F T , &c,

the Place* lot the whole Evening, without t h e usual exaction of an extra Shilling.

the end of the First Act.

PRIVATE BOXES Two Guineas and a Half, Two Guineas, and One Guinea and a Half, mi, be taken
at the Box-Office, and at the Libraries of Messrs MITCHELL, SAMS, ALLCROFT, &c,

BROWN STUDY of KING BROWN

The purchase of Tickets for the D R E S S CIRCLE, a t the Box-Offlce. will e»«Qre
the Places for the whole Evening without the usual exaction of an extra Shilling.
Those taken in the same way for the U P P E R C I R C L E , will ensure t h e Places t o
the end of the First Act,
Bo Money will be allowed to he received by th* Box-keepers, on any pretence
Whatever; and it is earnestly requested,that any complaint of incivility may be instantly
addressed to Madame V E S T R I S .
Separate Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes, on both sides of the
Bouse, have been constructed In Burleigh Street and Wellington Street.

The purchase of Tickets for t h e D R E S S C I R C L E a t t h e Box-Office, will easure
the Places for the whole Evening, without t h e usual exaction of an extra Shilling.

the end of t h e First Act,
B e Honey will be allowed to ho received by t h e Box-keepers, en any pretence
whatever; and it I* earnestly reqoested.that any complaint of Incivility may be Instantly
addressed to Madame V E S T R I S .

Bouse, have boon constructed in Burleigh Street and Wellington .Street.

at the Box-Office, and at the Libraries of Messrs. MITCHELL, SAMS, ALLCROFT, &e.

The purchase of Tickets for t h e D R E S S CIRCLE, a t the Box-Office, will ecsara
the Places for the whole Evening, without the usual exaction of an extra Shilling.
Those taken in t h e same way for the U P P E R C I R C L E , will ensure the Places t o
the end of the First A c t .
Bo Honey will be allowed t o be received by the Box-keeper*, on any pretence
whatever; and i t if earnestly requested,that any complaint of incivility may be instantly
addressed to Ufa dame V E S T R I S .
Separate Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes, on both side, of the.
House, have been constructed in Burleigh Street and Wellington Street.

Door* open a t half-past Six. t h e P e r f o r m a n c e * commence a t Seven, and a r e
a r r a n g e d t o t e r m i n a t e a s n e a r E l e v e n o ' c l o c k a* p o s s i b l e .
P R I V A T E S O X E S Two Guineas and a Half, Two Guineas, and One Guinea and a Half, m.y be taken

at the Box-Office, and at the Libraries of Messrs. MITCHELL, SAMS. ALLCROFT, &«.,
T h e purchase of Tickets for t h e D R E S S CJURCJEiE, a t the Box-Office will ensure
the Places for the whole Evening, without the usual exaction of an extra Shilling.
Those t a k e n In the t o n e way for the U P P E R C I R C L E , will ensure t h e Places t o
the end of the First Act.
No Money will lie allowed to h e received by t h e Box-keepers, on any pretence
whatever; and i t I* earnestly requested,that any complaint of incivility may be instantly
addressed to Madame V E S T R I S .
Separate Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes, on both sides ef the
House, have been constructed in Burleigh Street and Wellington Street,

the Places for the whole Evening, without the Usual exaction of an extra Shilling.

the end of the First Act.

whatever; and i t i» earnestly requested,that any oomplalat of incivility may be instantly
addressed to Madame V E S T R I S .

House, have been constructed in Burleigh Street and Wellington Street.

at the Box-Offfce, and at the Libraries of Messrs. M I T C H E L L , S A M S , A L L C R O F T , k e ,

T h e purchase of Tickets for the D R E S S CIRCLE, a t the B«x-Office. will el sure
the Places for the whole Evening, without the usual exaction of an extra Shilling.
Those taken in the same way for the U P P E R C I R C L E , will ensure the Places t o
the end of the First Act.
No Roney will be allowed to be received by the Box-keepers, on any pretence
whatever; and it is earnestly requested,that any complaint of incivility may be instantly
addressed to Madame V E S T R I S .
Separate Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes, on both sides of the
Rouse, have been constructed in Burleigh Street and Wellington Street.

T h e purchase of Tickets for the D R E B S C I R C L E , a t the Box-Office, will ensure
the Places for the whole .Evening, -without the usual exaction of an extra Shilling.
Those taken in the same -ray for the U P P E R CIRCLE", will ensure t h e P l a c e s t o
the end of the First Act.
No Honey will be allowed t o be received by t h e Box-keepers, on any p r e t e n c e
whatever: and it I , earnestly reqaested.that any complaint of incivility may he Instantly
addressed to B a d '.me Y E S T R I S .
Separate Entrances and Waiting Room, to the Private Boxes, on both sides of t h e
House, have s e e s constructed in Burleigh Street and Wellington .Street.

the Places for the whole Evening, with on t the ainal exaction of an extra Shilling.

the end of the First Aot.

whatever, and it is earnestly requested.that any complaint of incivility may be instantly
addressed to Madame V E S T R I S .
Separata Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes, on both sides of the
House, have been constructed in Burleigh Street aad Wellington Street.

NO HALF PRICE TO AMY PART OF THE HOUSE.

Poors open a t ha If.past Six, t h e P e r f o r m a n c e s c o m m e n c e a t Seven, and a r e
a r r a n g e d to t e r m i n a t e as n e a r Eleven o ' c l o c k as possible.
P R I V A T E B O X E S Two Guineas and a Half, Two Guineas, a n ) Oae Guinea and a Half, miy be taken
al the Box-Office, and at the Libraries of Messrs M I T C H E L L , SSAMS. A L L C R O E T , &c.

The purchase of Tickets for the DRESS CIRCLE, at the Box-Office,
will ensure the Placesforthe whole Evening, without the usual exaction
of an extra Shilling.
Those taken in the same way for the UPPER CIRCLE, will ensure
the Places to the end of the First Act.
No Money will be allowed to he received bv the Box-keepers, on any
pretence whatever; and it is earnestly requested, that any complaint of
incivility may be instantly addressed to Madame VESTRIS.
Separate Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes- on
both sides of the House, have been constructed in Burleigh Street and
Wellington Street.
The New BOX-OFFICE, adjoining the Theatre, in WELLINGTON
ST.RBBT, is open daily from 10 tiU 6 o Clock, under the Super in
tendance of Mr. GROGAN.

of an e x t r a Shilling.

t h e Places to the end of t h e F i r s t A c t .

pretence w h a t e v e r , and i t is earnestly requested, t h a t a n y c o m p l a i n t of
i n c i v i l i t y may be instantly addressed t o M a d a m e V E S T R I S .

b o t h sides of t h e House, have been constructed i n Burleigh S t r e e t and
Wellington Street.

The purchase of Tickets for the DRESS CIRCLE, at the Box-Office,
will ensure the Places for the whole Evening, without the usual exaction
of an extra Shilling.
Those taken in t h e same w a y for the U P P E R CIRCLE, will ensure
the Places to t h e end of the First Act.
No Money will be allowed to be received bv the Box-keep sli, on any
pretence whatever J and it is earnestly requested, that any complaint of
incivility may be instantly addressed to Madame V E S T R I S .
Separate Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes on
both sides of the House, have been constructed in Burleigh Street and
Wellington Street.
The New BOX-OFFICE, adjoining the Theatre, in WELLINGTON
S T R E E T , is open daily front 10 till 6 o Clock, under t h e Superintendance of Mr. GROGAN.

The purchase of Tickets for the DRESS CIRCLE, at the Box-Office*
will ensure the Places for the whole Evening, without the usual exaction
Of an extra Shilling.
Those taken in t h e same w a y for t h e U P P E R CIRCLE, will ensure
the Places to the end of the First Act.
No Money will be allowed to be received bv t h e Box-keep ers, on anv
pretence whatever; and it is earnestly requested, that amy complaint of
incivility may be instantly addressed to Madame V E S T R I S .
Separate Entrances and Waiting Rooms to the Private Boxes, on
both sides of the House, have been constructed in Burleigh Street and
Wellington Street.
The New BOX-OFFICE, adjoining the Theatre, in W E L L I N G T O N
S T R E E T , is open daily from 10 till 6 o Clock, under the Superin
tendance of Mr. GROGAN.

THE
THE

" A thousand doors a thousand winding ways."
"R.ic*wastoewor.k,.omt.rieate
**-"• ^ M i - - B w k V i
That scarce the workman aU its turns could trace
These private walls the Minotaur include.
Who twice was glutted with Athenian blood,
But the third tribute more successful proved,
Slew the foul monster, and the plague removed." 0*4. MM. Book vui.

Legend of Ariadne.

• A thousand doors—a thousand winding ways.Virgil,
" Such was the work, so intrloata the place,
That scarce the workman all its turns oould trace
These private wails the Minotaur include,
Who twice was glutted with Athenian blood,
.Rot the third tribute more successful proved,
Slew the foul monster, and the plague removed." Orid.

Character of THESEUS will, therefore, be undertaken by

BEFORE THE TEMPLE OF BACCHUS.
" And now the God of Wine comes driving on,
High on his chariot by swift tigers drawn." o '

By tigers drawn triumphant in his car,
With curling vines around his purple reins,"
